ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY

Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I am willing to use new and different types of treatments if they have evidence of being effective.
Notes: 0 = not at all; 1 = to a slight extent; 2 = to a moderate extent; 3 = to a great extent; 4 = to a very great extent; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: Evidence-based treatments do not allow me to tailor my therapy to each client's individual needs.
Notes: 0 = not at all; 1 = to a slight extent; 2 = to a moderate extent; 3 = to a great extent; 4 = to a very great extent; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: Clinical experience and judgment are more important than using evidence-based treatments.
Notes: 0 = not at all; 1 = to a slight extent; 2 = to a moderate extent; 3 = to a great extent; 4 = to a very great extent; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: I like using evidence-based treatments because of the structure they provide.
Notes: 0 = not at all; 1 = to a slight extent; 2 = to a moderate extent; 3 = to a great extent; 4 = to a very great extent; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: A problem with evidence-based treatments is that you need to learn a different program for each diagnosis or problem area.
Notes: 0 = not at all; 1 = to a slight extent; 2 = to a moderate extent; 3 = to a great extent; 4 = to a very great extent; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: Evidence-based treatments allow clinicians to respond to important events in therapy as they come up.
Notes: 0 = not at all; 1 = to a slight extent; 2 = to a moderate extent; 3 = to a great extent; 4 = to a very great extent; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: I dislike evidence-based treatments because they are too inflexible.
Notes: 0 = not at all; 1 = to a slight extent; 2 = to a moderate extent; 3 = to a great extent; 4 = to a very great extent; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing

ElementDescription: Evidence-based treatments are not designed to handle clients with more than one diagnosis or other challenges that are common in real world therapy.
Notes: 0 = not at all; 1 = to a slight extent; 2 = to a moderate extent; 3 = to a great extent; 4 = to a very great extent; 888 = not applicable; 999 = missing
